page.title: 15Lower Tadmarton Village (1)
page.content: Lower Tadmarton is a little {hamlet} in a valley. It has very few buildings, although it has an {agricultural factory} and 5 people are employed there. There is a lovely {brook} running through the back of some gardens. It also runs through the back of a farm. It used to run through the middle of a field to a water wheel and so the farm is called Â£The Mill'. There is a public Bridleway through a field. There are lots of dry-stone walls. There is also a {dry-stone barn} that is still in perfect condition. One of the houses that is called Â£Rosegarth' is where one of the teachers from our school lives. Some of the houses are old and some are modern. You can see which are old because either they are made of {Hornton Stone}, or they have small windows, or they have a thatched roof.
